TEXT.Italian: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended. Many troops are not needed anymore and have been sent home again. Maybe we could hire some of them.
TEXT.Spanish: A large scale military conflict in Europe has ended. Many troops are not needed anymore and have been sent home again. Maybe we could hire some of them.

TEXT.English: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.
TEXT.French: Nous avons vraiment besoin d'un général expérimenté pour mener nos hommes.
TEXT.German: Wir brauchen einen erfahrenen General um unserer Truppen zu führen.
TEXT.Italian: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.
TEXT.Spanish: We really need an experienced general to lead our troops.

TEXT.English: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.
TEXT.French: Peut-être devrions-nous engager quelques troupes d'élite.
TEXT.German: Vielleicht gelingt es uns einige Elitetruppen zu rekrutieren.
TEXT.Italian: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.
TEXT.Spanish: Maybe we can hire some elite troops.

TEXT.English: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.
TEXT.French: Quelques vétérans pour renforcer nos troupes ne feront pas de mal.
TEXT.German: Einige Veterane um unsere Truppen zu stärken, wäre sicherlich nicht verkehrt.
TEXT.Italian: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.
TEXT.Spanish: A few more veterans to strengthen our forces would not hurt.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre d'investir dans notre armée en ce moment.
TEXT.German: Wir können es uns momentan nicht leisten für mehr Truppen Geld auszugeben.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford to invest into more military.

TEXT.English: A drunken fisher died in a storm.
TEXT.French: Un pêcheur alcoolisé est moort dans une tempête.
TEXT.German: Ein betrunkener Fischer starb in einem Sturm.
TEXT.Italian: A drunken fisher died in a storm.
TEXT.Spanish: A drunken fisher died in a storm.

TEXT.English: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.
TEXT.French: Un pêcheur alcoolisé est passé par dessus bord lors d'une tempête. Il s'est noyé. Sa veuve souhaite vendre son bâteau de pêche, n'en ayant plus d'usage.
TEXT.German: Ein betrunkener Fischer fiel während eines Sturms über Bord und ertrank. Seine Witwe möchte nun dessen Fischerboot verkaufen, da sie keine Verwendung dafür hat.
TEXT.Italian: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.
TEXT.Spanish: A drunken fisher fell over board during a storm and drowned. His widow now wants to sell his fishing boat, since she has no usage for it.

TEXT.English: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.
TEXT.French: Nous aiderons cette pauvre veuve et achetons le bateau à un bon prix.
TEXT.German: Wir werden der Witwe helfen und das Boot zu einem fairen Preis kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.
TEXT.Spanish: We will help the poor widow and buy the boat for a good price.

TEXT.English: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.French: C'est triste, mais ce ne sont pas nos affaires.
TEXT.German: Das ist zwar traurig, betrifft uns aber nicht.
TEXT.Italian: This is sad, but it is not our business.
TEXT.Spanish: This is sad, but it is not our business.

TEXT.English: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.
TEXT.French: Un boûcher venu d'Europe est accusé d'être en fuite après avoir vendu de la viande pourrie.
TEXT.German: Ein Schlachtermeister ist aus Europa geflohen, weil er verdorbenes Fleisch verkauft haben soll.
TEXT.Italian: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.
TEXT.Spanish: A Butcher has fled Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat.

TEXT.English: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.
TEXT.French: Un ancien boûcher est arrivé au port de l'une de nos villes. Il a fui d'Europe parce qu'il était accusé d'avoir vendu de la viande pourrie. Il clâme son innocence et souhaite qu'on lui laisse une deuxième chance.
TEXT.German: Ein Schlachtermeister ist im Hafen einer unserer Städte eingetroffen. Er musste aus Europa fliehen, weil er verdorbenes Fleisch verkauft haben soll. Er behauptet aber unschuldig zu sein und bittet um eine zweite Chance.
TEXT.Italian: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.
TEXT.Spanish: A former Butcher has arrived in the harbor of one of our cities. He had to flee Europe because he was accused of selling rotten meat. He pleads that he is innocent and wants us to give him a second chance.

TEXT.English: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.
TEXT.French: Tout le monde mérite une deuxième chance. Nous pouvons le laisser exercer sa profession et nous paierons les autorités européennes pour qu'elles oublient l'incident.
TEXT.German: Jeder verdient eine zweite Chance. Lasst den Mann in seinem alten Beruf arbeiten und bezahlt die Authoritäten in Europa diesen Vorfall zu vergessen.
TEXT.Italian: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.
TEXT.Spanish: Everybody deserves a second chance. Let him work in his old profession and pay the European authorities to forget about the incident.

TEXT.English: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.French: Nous allons extrader cette homme pour le rendre aux autorités qui le demandent en Europe.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diesen Mann der Authorität in Europa überstellen.
TEXT.Italian: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.

TEXT.English: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.
TEXT.French: Des conquistadors désespérés ont pillé un village indigène.
TEXT.German: Einige verzweifelte Conquistadores haben ein Ureinwohnerdorf überfallen.
TEXT.Italian: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Desperate Conquistadores have raided a Native settlement.

TEXT.English: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.
TEXT.French: Des conquistadors à cheval sont arrivés dans l'une de nos villes dans un bien triste état. Ils comptent plusieurs blessés. Peu de temps après, des indigènes d'une tribu voisine sont également arrivés et ont accusé les conquistadors d'avoir réalisé un raide dans leurs villages.
TEXT.German: Einige berittene Conquistadores in sehr schlechtem Zustand sind in einer unserer Siedlungen angekommen. Einige von ihnen sind verwundet. Kurz darauf trafen auch einige Ureinwohner eines nahegelegenen Stammes ein und beschuldigten die Conquistadores ihre Dörfer überfallen zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Mounted Conquistadores in pretty bad shape arrived in on of our settlements. Some of them are wounded. Shortly later some Natives of a nearby tribe arrived as well and accused those Conquistadores of having raided their villages.

TEXT.English: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.
TEXT.French: Que ces égorgeurs soient enchaînés. Nous n'autorisons personne à s'en prendre à nos amis indigènes.
TEXT.German: Legt diesen Halsabschneidern ketten an. Niemand darf ungestraft unsere wilden Freunde angreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.
TEXT.Spanish: Put those cutthroats in chains. We will allow nobody to raid our Native friends.

TEXT.English: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.
TEXT.French: Ces hommes étaient désespérés. Nous allons les mettre à notre service et un tel incident n'arrivera plus.
TEXT.German: Die Männer waren schlicht verzweifelt. Wir werden sie in uneren Dienst stellen und Sorge tragen, dass so etwas nicht wieder vor kommt.
TEXT.Italian: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.
TEXT.Spanish: Those man were simply desperate. They will be put into our service and such an incident will not happen again.

TEXT.English: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.
TEXT.French: Des tensions montent entre trappeurs et indigènes à propos de droits de chasse.
TEXT.German: Konflikte zwischen Trappern und Ureinwohnern über Jagdrechte.
TEXT.Italian: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.
TEXT.Spanish: Trouble between trappers and Natives over hunting rights.

TEXT.English: Close to one of our forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.
TEXT.French: À proximité de l'un de nos forts, nos troupes ont entendu des tirs dans les bois. En menant l'investigation, ils se sont confrontés à une querelle entre des trappeurs et des indigènes à propos de droits de chasse. Les indigènes considèrent que cette forêt leur appartient et que les blancs n'y sont pas autorisés à chasser.
TEXT.German: In der Nähe eines unserer Forts haben die Truppen Schüsse in den Wäldern gehört. Als sie diese untersuchten, fanden sie Ureinwohner und Trapper in eine Streit über Jagdrechte in den umliegenden Wäldern. Die Ureinwohner behaupten, dass das Land immer noch ihnen gehört und dass dort kein weisser Mann ohne ihre Erlaubnis jagen darf.
TEXT.Italian: Close to one of our forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.
TEXT.Spanish: Close to one of our Forts, our troops heard shots in the woods. When they went out of the fort to investigate, they stumbled into an argument between Natives and Trappers about hunting rights in the nearby forests. The Natives claim that those forests still belong to them and that no white man is allowed to be hunting in them.

TEXT.English: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.French: Les trappeurs doivent quitter la forêt immédiatement. Ces terres appartiennent effectivement aux indigènes.
TEXT.German: Die Trapper sollen diese Wälder sofort verlassen. Sie gehören unseren wilden Freunden.
TEXT.Italian: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.Spanish: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.

TEXT.English: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.French: Nous allons acheter ces forêts à nos amis indigènes et engager les trappeurs pour qu'ils travaillent pour nous.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diese Wälder kaufen und die Trapper für uns arbeiten lassen.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.

TEXT.English: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.
TEXT.French: Des truands occupent les bois.
TEXT.German: Halsabschneider machen die Wälder unsicher.
TEXT.Italian: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.
TEXT.Spanish: Cutthroats are roaming the woods.

TEXT.English: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.
TEXT.French: Selon plusieurs rapports, des truands occupent les bois. Heureusement nous disposons d'un fort à proximité et nous pouvons faire intervenir des troupes.
TEXT.German: In der Nähe eines unserer Forts scheinen sich einige Halsabschneider in den Wäldern zu verstecken. Sollen unsere Truppen eingreifen ?.
TEXT.Italian: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.
TEXT.Spanish: We have heard reports that some cutthroats are roaming the woods. Luckily one of our forts is nearby and could send troops to intervene.

TEXT.English: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.
TEXT.French: Nos troupes doivent marquer l'esprit de ces truands en leur donnant une leçon qu'ils ne seront pas prêts d'oublier.
TEXT.German: Unsere Truppen sollen diesen Halsabschneidern eine Lektion erteilen. Dies soll auch eine Warnung an anderen Abschaum sein.
TEXT.Italian: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.
TEXT.Spanish: Our troops shall teach those cutthroats a lesson they will not forget. It shall be a warning to other such scum.

TEXT.English: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.
TEXT.French: Cherchez à identifier ses pauvres âmes et donnez leur une chance de se réinsérer dans la société.
TEXT.German: Versucht diese armen Seelen zu finden und gebt ihnen eine Chance in die zivilisierte Gesellschaft zurückzukehren.
TEXT.Italian: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.
TEXT.Spanish: Try to find those poor souls and give them a chance to return to civilized society.

TEXT.English: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.
TEXT.French: Des hommes dans les terres sauvages s'approvisionnent dans les forts.
TEXT.German: Männer in der Wildniss nutzen die Forts um Vorräte zu kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.
TEXT.Spanish: Men from the wilderness buy supplies in the forts.

TEXT.English: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.
TEXT.French: Des hommes vivant dans les terres sauvages sont venu pour s'approvisionner dans nos forts. Ils semblent bien connaître les environs et pourraient nous être utiles.
TEXT.German: Einige Männer, die in der nahegelegenen Wildniss leben, sind in unser Fort gekommen um Vorräte zu kaufen. Es scheint als hätten sie sehr viel Wissen über die Gegend. Daher könnten sie uns sehr nützlich sein.
TEXT.Italian: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Some men living in the nearby wilderness have come to one of our forts to buy supplies. They seem to have gathered a lot of knowledge of the area and could be very useful to us.

TEXT.English: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.French: Bien. Vendons leurs ce dont ils ont besoin.
TEXT.German: Dann verkauft ihnen die Vorräte, die sie wollen.
TEXT.Italian: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.

TEXT.English: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.French: Ils pourraient sans doute faire de très bons éclaireurs. Essayez de les engager.
TEXT.German: Sie wären us sicherlich als Kundschafter sehr dienlich.
TEXT.Italian: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.Spanish: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.

TEXT.English: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.French: Essayez de les convaincre de rejoindre nos forces en tant que gardes-forestiers.
TEXT.German: Versucht sie zu überzeugen unseren Truppen als Rangers zu dienen.
TEXT.Italian: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.Spanish: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.

TEXT.English: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.
TEXT.French: Après un hiver long et vigoureux, des indigènes sont venues au Monastère pour acheter de la nourriture.
TEXT.German: Nach einem langen harten Winter kamen Ureinwohner in ein Kloster um Nahrung zu kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.
TEXT.Spanish: After a long, hard winter, Natives have come to a Monastery to buy some food.

TEXT.English: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.
TEXT.French: Après un hiver long et vigoureux, des indigènes sont venues au Monastère pour acheter de la nourriture. Ils n'ont pas grand-chose à offrir en échange.
TEXT.German: Nach einem langen harten Winter kamen Ureinwohner aus einem benachbarten Dorf in eines unserer Kloster um Nahrung zu kaufen. Sie haben aber im Austausch wenig anzubieten.
TEXT.Italian: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: After a long, hard winter, Natives from a nearby village have come to one of our Monasteries to buy some food. They do not have much to offer in exchange.

TEXT.English: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.French: Vendez leur de la nourriture à un prix qu'ils trouveront honnête.
TEXT.German: Verkauft ihnen ein wenig unserer Nahrungsvorräte.
TEXT.Italian: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.

TEXT.English: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.French: Faîtes leur don de la moitié de la nourriture stockée dans la ville la plus proche.
TEXT.German: Schenkt ihnen die Hälfte der Nahrungsvorräte der am Nächsten gelegenen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.Spanish: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.

TEXT.English: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.French: L'hiver a été dur pour nous aussi. Nous ne pouvons pas nous priver de notre nourriture.
TEXT.German: Es war auch für uns ein harter Winter. Wir können keine Nahrung erübrigen.
TEXT.Italian: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.Spanish: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.

TEXT.English: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.
TEXT.French: Des esclaves indigènes se sont enfuis et cherchent la protection dans nos monastères.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohnersklaven entfliehen der Gefangenschaft des Weissen Mannes und suche Schutz in Klöstern.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native slaves escaped the white man and seek protection in Monasteries.

TEXT.English: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.
TEXT.French: Des esclaves indigènes se sont enfuis de chez l'un de nos voisins européens et cherchent la protection de l'un de nos monastères. Des troupes des colons européens voisins encerclent le monastère et demandent que leur propriété leur soit rendu.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohnersklaven konnten der Gefangenschaft eines unserer europäischen Nachbarn entfliehen und suchen nun Schutz in einem unserer Klöstern. Truppen unseres Nachbarn haben aber bereits das Kloster umstellt und verlangen die Herausgabe der Sklaven.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native slaves escaped from one of our European neighbours and seek protection in one of our Monasteries. Troops of our European neighbour have surrounded the Monastery and demand that their property is returned to them.

TEXT.English: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.French: Ces esclaves doivent être rendus à leur maître. C'est la loi.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen dem Gesetz Folge leisten und die Sklaven wieder unserem Nachbarn übergeben.
TEXT.Italian: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.

TEXT.English: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.French: Ces esclaves sont mainenant les nôtres. Nos voisins n'oseront pas attaquer un monastère.
TEXT.German: Die Sklaven gehören nun uns. Unser Nachbar wird es nicht wagen ein Kloster anzugreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.Spanish: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.

TEXT.English: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.
TEXT.French: Nous achèterons la liberté de ses pauvres hommes et nous leur laissons une chance de vivre parmi nous.
TEXT.German: Wird werden die Sklaven freikaufen und ihnen eine Chance geben wieder als freie Menschen zu leben.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.

TEXT.English: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.
TEXT.French: Des indigènes ont apporté un guerrier blessé dans un monastère.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner brachten Verwundeten in ein Kloster.
TEXT.Italian: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives brought a wounded warrior to a Monastery.

TEXT.English: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.
TEXT.French: Des indigènes d'un village avoisinant ont ramené un jeune guerrier sérieusement blessé dans l'un de nos monastères. Il semble avoir été attaqué par un ours. Si nous ne l'aidons pas, il va probablement mourrir.
TEXT.German: Einige Ureinwohner eines nahegelegen Dorfes haben einen schwer verwundeten jungen Krieger in eines unserer Klöster gebracht. Er scheint vom einem Bären angegriffen worden zu sein. Wenn wir nicht helfen, wird er sterben.
TEXT.Italian: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.
TEXT.Spanish: Some Native from a nearby village brought a heavily wounded young warrior to one of our Monasteries. It seems like he was attacked by a bear. If we do not help him, he will surely die.

TEXT.English: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.French: Bien sûr que nous allons aider. Essayez de le stabiliser. Nous allons dépêcher l'un de nos médecins immédiatement.
TEXT.German: Natürlich werden wir helfen. Versucht ihn zu stabilisieren, bis ein Arzt mit Medikamenten eintrifft.
TEXT.Italian: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.Spanish: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.

TEXT.English: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.
TEXT.French: Nous allons aider ce jeune guerrier. Les indigènes devront cependant prendre en charge les frais élevés que cela représente en envoyant de la nourriture à notre ville la plus proche.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem jungen Kriegern helfen. Als Gegenleistung sollen die Ureinwohner aber etwas Nahrung in unsere nächste Stadt schicken.
TEXT.Italian: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.

TEXT.English: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.French: Faîtes ce que vous pouvez pour lui sauver la vie. S'il survie, rappelez lui sa dette de sang envers nous.
TEXT.German: Tut was immer ihr könnt um sein Leben zu retten. Wenn er überlebt, erinnert ihn daran dass er uns gegenüber eine Blutschuld trägt.
TEXT.Italian: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.

TEXT.English: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: La première université a été fondée à %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die erste Universität der Neuen Welt wurde in %s2_city gegründet.
TEXT.Italian: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: The first university has been founded in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: An influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.
TEXT.French: Une société influente d'hommes éduqués dans notre mère patrie ont entendu parlé de la fondation de notre première université. Ils souhaitent nous aider en nous envoyer un de leur sage pour y enseigner.
TEXT.German: Eine einflussreiche Gesellschaft gebildeter Männer unseres Heimatlandes hat von der Gründung unserer ersten Universität erfahren. Sie wollen uns helfen, indem sie uns einen hoch gebildeten Mann schicken wollen, der unsere Studenten unterrichtet.
TEXT.Italian: A influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.
TEXT.Spanish: A influential society of educated men in our mother country heard about the foundation of our first Universtiy. They want to help us by sending a highly educated man to work as a professor.

TEXT.English: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.
TEXT.French: Nous pourrions avoir besoin d'un bon professeur en sciences politiques.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten jemanden gebrauchen, der unsere Studenten in Politik unterrichtet.
TEXT.Italian: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.
TEXT.Spanish: We could use someone to teach our students about politics.

TEXT.English: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.
TEXT.French: Demandez un théologien. La religion est ce qui compte le plus.
TEXT.German: Fragt nach einem Theologen. Religion ist wichtig.
TEXT.Italian: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.
TEXT.Spanish: Ask for a theologist. Religion is an important matter.

TEXT.English: What we need most is a medical doctor.
TEXT.French: Ce dont nous avons le plus besoin est un médecin. Nos soins doivent se développer.
TEXT.German: Was wir am meisten benötigen ist ein Mediziner.
TEXT.Italian: What we need most is a medical doctor.
TEXT.Spanish: What we need most is a medical doctor.

TEXT.English: That is very friendly of our Native neighbours. Send them some food from the nearest city to thank them.
TEXT.French: C'est très aimable de la part de nos voisins indigènes. Envoyez leur de la nourriture provenant de la ville la plus proche pour les en remercier.
TEXT.German: Das ist sehr nachbarschaftlich von unseren Ureinwohnerfreunden. Schickt ihnen zum Dank etwas Nahrung aus einer nahegelegenen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: That is very friendly of our Native neighbours. Send them some food from the nearest city to thank them.
TEXT.Spanish: That is very friendly of our Native neighbours. Send them some food from the nearest city to thank them.

TEXT.English: Large swarms of cod in the oceans.
TEXT.French: Des bancs massifs de cabillauds dans les océans.
TEXT.German: Riesige Kabeljauschwärme in den Ozeanen.
TEXT.Italian: Large swarms of cod in the oceans.
TEXT.Spanish: Large swarms of cod in the oceans.

TEXT.English: One of our fishing boats has sighted a large swarm of young cod. If we harvest those fish now, the swarm will probably not recover.
TEXT.French: L'un de nos bateaux de pêche a repéré de larges bancs de jeunes cabillauds. Si nous les pêchons tous d'un seul coup, il ne pourra probablement pas se reproduire.
TEXT.German: Eines unserer Fischerboote hat einen riesigen Schwarm junger Kabeljaufische entdeckt. Wenn wir ihn jedoch jetzt bereits abfischen, wird es sich nicht davon erholen.
TEXT.Italian: One of our fishing boats has sighted a large swarm of young cod. If we harvest those fish now, the swarm will probably not recover.
TEXT.Spanish: One of our fishing boats has sighted a large swarm of young cod. If we harvest those fish now, the swarm will probably not recover.

TEXT.English: We should wait until the fish in the swarm have grown out.
TEXT.French: Nous devons attendre que le poisson arrive à maturité.
TEXT.German: Wir sollten warten bis die Fische des Schwarms ausgewachsen sind.
TEXT.Italian: We should wait until the fish in the swarm have grown out.
TEXT.Spanish: We should wait until the fish in the swarm have grown out.

TEXT.English: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin de ces poissons maintenant. Remplissez les filets et prenez tout ce que vous pouvez.
TEXT.German: Wir brauchen diese Fische aber bereits jetzt. Füllt eure Netze mit allem, was ihr fangen könnt.
TEXT.Italian: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.
TEXT.Spanish: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.

TEXT.English: An influential trading company wants to expand its business in the New World. It offers a reward to the first colony to build 5 cities with Docks or even better harbours.
TEXT.French: Une grande compagnie financière souhaite développer ses activités dans le Nouveau Monde. Elle offre une récompense à la première colonie qui construira 5 villes disposant de docks ou de meilleurs ports.
TEXT.German: Eine einflussreiche Handelsgesellschaft will ihre Unternehmungen in der Neuen Welt ausweiten. Sie bietet daher der ersten Kolonie, die 5 Städte mit einfachen oder ausgebauten Häfen errichtet, eine Belohnung an.
TEXT.Italian: An influential trading company wants to expand its business in the New World. It offers a reward to the first colony to build 5 cities with Docks or even better harbours.
TEXT.Spanish: An influential trading company wants to expand its business in the New World. It offers a reward to the first colony to build 5 cities with Docks or even better harbours.

TEXT.English: Well, we were planning to build many harbours anyways. But an additional reward shall be welcome.
TEXT.French: Bien, nous avions prévus de construire plusieurs ports de toute manière. Une récompense additionnelle ne peut être que la bienvenue.
TEXT.German: Wir wollten zwar sowieso mehrere Hafenstädte gründen, aber eine zusätzliche Belohnung ist natürlich sehr willkommen.
TEXT.Italian: Well, we were planning to build many harbours anyways. But an additional reward shall be welcome.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, we were planning to build many harbours anyways. But an additional reward shall be welcome.

TEXT.English: Another colony has built harbours in 5 cities before you. They are now granted support from an influential trading company.
TEXT.French: Une autre puissance a construit 5 ports avant vous. Ils ont obtenu le soutien de la compagnie financière influente.
TEXT.German: Eine andere Kolonie konnte vor euch in 5 Städten Häfen errichten. Sie werden daher nun von einer einflussreiche Handelsgesellschaft unterstützt.
TEXT.Italian: Another colony has built harbours in 5 cities before you. They are now granted support from an influential trading company.
TEXT.Spanish: Another colony has built harbours in 5 cities before you. They are now granted support from an influential trading company.

TEXT.English: A colonial power has built harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could.
TEXT.French: Une colonie a été la première a construire 5 ports avant les autres.
TEXT.German: Eine Kolonialmacht konnte vor allen anderen in 5 Städten Häfen errichten.
TEXT.Italian: A colonial power hasbuilt harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could.
TEXT.Spanish: A colonial power hasbuilt harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could.

TEXT.English: You have built harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could. You are now granted support from an influential trading company. Choose your reward.
TEXT.French: Vous avez été le première à construire 5 ports dans vos colonies. Vous avez obtenu le soutien d'une grande compagnie financière. Choisissez votre récompense.
TEXT.German: Eure Kolonie konnte vor allen anderen in 5 Städten Häfen errichten. Ihr werdet daher nun von einer einflussreiche Handelsgesellschaft unterstützt. Wählt eure Belohnung.
TEXT.Italian: You have built harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could. You are now granted support from an influential trading company. Choose your reward.
TEXT.Spanish: You have built harbours in 5 cities before any other colony could. You are now granted support from an influential trading company. Choose your reward.

TEXT.English: Gold is always useful.
TEXT.French: De l'or. Cela est utile pour tout.
TEXT.German: Gold kann man immer gebrauchen.
TEXT.Italian: Gold is always useful.
TEXT.Spanish: Gold is always useful.

TEXT.English: We would need a military ship to protect our trade routes.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin d'un navire militaire pour protéger nos routes commerciales.
TEXT.German: Ein Kriegsschiff könnte unsere Handelswege beschützen.
TEXT.Italian: We would need a military ship to protect our trade routes.
TEXT.Spanish: We would need a military ship to protect our trade routes.

TEXT.English: Another trading ship is needed to keep up with our increasing production.
TEXT.French: Un nouveau bateau de commerce est nécessaire pour soutenir la production croissante.
TEXT.German: Wir brauchen ein weiters Handelsschiff um mit unserer steigenden Produktion mitzuhalten.
TEXT.Italian: Another trading ship is needed to keep up with our increasing production.
TEXT.Spanish: Another trading ship is needed to keep up with our increasing production.

TEXT.English: A group of private traders in our colony demands that we invest into more markets in the colonies. They even offer a reward to us, if we are the first colony to have 5 cities with markets.
TEXT.French: Des négociants privés dans nos colonies nous demandent d'investir dans davantage de marchés. Ils nous proposent même une récompense si nous devenons la première puissance coloniale à construire 5 marchés.
TEXT.German: Eine einflussreiche Gruppe von Händler aus unseren Städten fordert, dass wir mehr Märkte in den Kolonien bauen. Sie bietet als Anreiz sogar eine Belohnung, falls wir als erste erste Kolonie in 5 Städten Märkte errichtet haben.
TEXT.Italian: A group of private traders in our colony demands that we invest into more markets in the colonies. They even offer a reward to us, if we are the first colony to have 5 cities with markets.
TEXT.Spanish: A group of private traders in our colony demands that we invest into more markets in the colonies. They even offer a reward to us, if we are the first colony to have 5 cities with markets.

TEXT.English: That sounds reasonable. We should strengthen our domestic market.
TEXT.French: Cela semble raisonnable. Nous devons renforcer notre marché intérieur.
TEXT.German: Das klingt nach einem guten Vorschlag. Wir sollten unseren heimischen Markt stärken.
TEXT.Italian: That sounds reasonable. We should strengthen our domestic market.
TEXT.Spanish: That sounds reasonable. We should strengthen our domestic market.

TEXT.English: Another colony has built markets in 5 cities before you. You have lost the chance to win the reward of our private traders.
TEXT.French: Une autre colonie a construit 5 marchés dans ses villes avant nous. Vous avez perdu votre chance de gagner une récompense de la part des négociants privés.
TEXT.German: Eine andere Kolonie konnte vor euch in 5 Städten Märkte errichten. Dadurch habt ihr die Chance auf eine Belohung durch unsere eigenen Händler vertan.
TEXT.Italian: Another colony has built markets in 5 cities before you. You have lost the chance to win the reward of our private traders.
TEXT.Spanish: Another colony has built markets in 5 cities before you. You have lost the chance to win the reward of our private traders.

TEXT.English: A colonial power has built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could.
TEXT.French: Une puissance coloniale a été la première à construire des marchés dans 5 villes.
TEXT.German: Eine Kolonialmacht konnte vor allen anderen in 5 Städten Märkte errichten.
TEXT.Italian: A colonial power has built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could.
TEXT.Spanish: A colonial power has built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could.

TEXT.English: You have built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could. The group of private traders now asks which reward they could offer.
TEXT.French: Vous avez été le premier à construire 5 marchés dans vos villes. Les négociants privés vous proposent de choisir votre récompense.
TEXT.German: Eure Kolonie konnte vor allen anderen in 5 Städten Märkte errichten. Die Händler aus unseren Städten fragen nun, welche Belohnung ihr dafür wollt.
TEXT.Italian: You have built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could. The group of private traders now asks which reward they could offer.
TEXT.Spanish: You have built markets in 5 cities before all other colonies could. The group of private traders now asks which reward they could offer.

TEXT.English: They could build a larger market in one of our cities. Thus they will profit as well.
TEXT.French: Ils peuvent construire un marché encore plus grand dans l'une de nos villes. Les profits générés augmenteront ainsi.
TEXT.German: Sie sollen in einer unserer Städte den vorhandenen Markt ausbauen. So profitieren sie selbst auch davon.
TEXT.Italian: They could build a larger market in one of our cities. Thus they will profit as well.
TEXT.Spanish: They could build a larger market in one of our cities. Thus they will profit as well.

TEXT.English: We now have markets but we need roads to connect them. They shall hire some Pioneers.
TEXT.French: Nous avons certes des marchés mais nous avons besoin de routes pour les connecter. Ils peuvent nous embaucher des pionniers.
TEXT.German: Wir haben zwar nun die Märkte, aber diese müssen durch Strassen verbunden werden. Sie sollen einige Pioniere anheuern.
TEXT.Italian: We now have markets but we need roads to connect them. They shall hire some Pioneers.
TEXT.Spanish: We now have markets but we need roads to connect them. They shall hire some Pioneers.

TEXT.English: More Wagon Trains to transport the goods to the new markets would be useful.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin de convois terrestres pour transporter les biens vers ces nouveaux marchés.
TEXT.German: Mehr Wagenzüge wären sehr hilfreich, denn dann können wir die Waren besser zu den Märkten transportieren.
TEXT.Italian: More Wagon Trains to transport the goods to the new markets would be useful.
TEXT.Spanish: More Wagon Trains to transport the goods to the new markets would be useful.

TEXT.English: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire.
TEXT.French: Un grenier à maïs à %s2_city a pris feu.
TEXT.German: Eine Getreidekammer in %s2_city hat Feuer gefangen.
TEXT.Italian: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire.
TEXT.Spanish: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire.

TEXT.English: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire. Although the fire could be extinguished and most of the corn could be saved, the building is heavily damaged and will need to be repaired or it will crumble.
TEXT.French: Un grenier à maïs a pris feu à %s2_city. Même si le feu a pu être éteint, la récolte de grain n'a pas pu être sauvée, le bâtiment est très endommagé et a besoin de réparation pour ne pas s'écrouler.
TEXT.German: Eine Getreidekammer in %s2_city hat Feuer gefangen. Obwohl das Feuer glöscht werden konnten und das meiste Getreide gerettet wurde, muss das Gebäude wieder repariert werden, oder es wird zusammenfallen.
TEXT.Italian: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire. Although the fire could be extinguished and and most of the corn itself could be saved, the building is heavily damaged and will need to be repaired or it will crumble.
TEXT.Spanish: A corn chamber in %s2_city caught fire. Although the fire could be extinguished and and most of the corn could be saved, the building is heavily damaged and will need to be repaired or it will crumble.

TEXT.English: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.
TEXT.French: C'est une mauvaise nouvelle, mais nous ne disposons pas des moyens pour aider.
TEXT.German: Das sind wahrhaft schlechte Nachrichten, aber im Moment können wir nicht helfen.
TEXT.Italian: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.
TEXT.Spanish: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.

TEXT.English: The corn chamber shall be repaired immediately. We will pay for the costs.
TEXT.French: Le grenier doit être réparé immédiatement. Nous en paierons le prix.
TEXT.German: Die Getreidekammer soll unverzüglich repariert werden. Die Kosten werden wir übernehmen.
TEXT.Italian: The corn chamber shall be repaired immediately. We will pay for the costs.
TEXT.Spanish: The corn chamber shall be repaired immediately. We will pay for the costs.

TEXT.English: Let us not only repair the corn chamber. We should directly build a much bigger and better granary.
TEXT.French: Profitons de cette opportunité pour construire directement un grenier plus grand.
TEXT.German: Wir werden nicht nur die Getreidekammer reparieren lassen. Gebt direkt den Baum eines grossen Getreidespeichers in Auftrag.
TEXT.Italian: Let us not only repair the corn chamber. We should directly build a much bigger and better granary.
TEXT.Spanish: Let us not only repair the corn chamber. We should directly build a much bigger and better granary.

TEXT.English: The water of a well in %s2_city was contaminated with the corpse of a dead animal.
TEXT.French: L'eau d'un puit à %s2_city a été contaminé par le corps d'un animal mort.
TEXT.German: Das Wasser eines Brunnens in %s2_city wurde durch ein totes Tier verseucht.
TEXT.Italian: The water of a well in %s2_city was contaminated with the corpse of a dead animal.
TEXT.Spanish: The water of a well in %s2_city was contaminated with the corpse of a dead animal.

TEXT.English: An animal fell into one of our wells in %s2_city and drowned. Now the corpse has contaminated the water. We will need to seal the well and dig a new one.
TEXT.French: Un animal est tombé dans un de nos puits à %s2_city et s'y est noyé. Le corps a contaminé l'eau. Nous devons condamner le puit et en construire un nouveau.
TEXT.German: Ein Tier ist in einen unserer Brunnen in %s2_city gefallen und ertrunken. Nun hat dessen Körper das Wasser verseucht. Wir werden den Brunnen versiegeln und einen neuen Brunnen graben müssen.
TEXT.Italian: An animal fell into one of our wells in %s2_city and drowned. Now the corpse has contaminated the water. We will need to seal the well and dig a new one.
TEXT.Spanish: An animal fell into one of our wells in %s2_city and drowned. Now the corpse has contaminated the water. We will need to seal the well and dig a new one.

TEXT.English: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.
TEXT.French: C'est une mauvaise nouvelle, mais nous ne disposons pas des moyens pour aider.
TEXT.German: Das sind wahrhaft schlechte Nachrichten, aber im Moment können wir nicht helfen.
TEXT.Italian: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.
TEXT.Spanish: That is bad news, but we currently cannot afford to help.

TEXT.English: Then what are you waiting for? Bring out the shovels and start digging the new well!
TEXT.French: Qu'attendez-vous donc ? Apportez les pioches et commencez à creuser ce nouveau puit !
TEXT.German: Worauf wartet ihr dann. Holt eure Schaufeln und grabt einen neuen Brunnen.
TEXT.Italian: Then what are you waiting for? Bring out the shovels and start digging the new well!
TEXT.Spanish: Then what are you waiting for? Bring out the shovels and start digging the new well!

TEXT.English: Natives are hiding a gem mine.
TEXT.French: Des indigènes cachent une mine de diamant.
TEXT.German: Ureinwohner verstecken ein Edelsteinvorkommen.
TEXT.Italian: Natives are hiding a gem mine.
TEXT.Spanish: Natives are hiding a gem mine.

TEXT.English: Our men noticed that some of the Natives that visit their city wear necklaces with beautiful looking stones. They seem to be valuable gems. When asked about those stones, they told us that they were sacred to them but did not want to say where they found them.
TEXT.French: Nos hommes ont reperé des indigènes lors d'une de leur visite avec de magnifiques colliers de pierres précieuses. Ils croient qu'il s'agit de diamants. Quand la question leur a été posée, ils ont répondu qu'il s'agissait de pierres sacrées et n'ont pas voulu nous dire où ils les ont trouvés.
TEXT.German: Unsere Männer haben festgestellt, dass einige Ureinwohner die ihre Stadt besuchen Halsketten mit wunderschönen Steinen tragen. Diese scheinen wertvolle Edelsteine zu sein. Nach deren Herkunft befragt, reagierten die Ureinwohner ausweichend und sagten nur, dass diese ihnen heilig seien.
TEXT.Italian: Our men noticed that some of the Natives that visit their city wear necklaces with beautiful looking stones. They seem to be valuable gems. When asked about those stones, they told us that they were sacred to them but did not want to say where they found them.
TEXT.Spanish: Our men noticed that some of the Natives that visit their city wear necklaces with beautiful looking stones. They seem to be valuable gems. When asked about those stones, they told us that they were sacred to them but did not want to say where they found them.

TEXT.English: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.
TEXT.French: Envoyez des hommes pour les suivre sans se faire repérer. Ils pourront nous emmener vers cette mine cachée.
TEXT.German: Lasst einige unsere Männer die Ureinwohner vorsichtig verfolgen. Sie führen uns vieleicht zu einer versteckten Edelsteinmine
TEXT.Italian: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.
TEXT.Spanish: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.

TEXT.English: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.
TEXT.French: Dîtes à nos hommes qu'ils doivent respecter la volonté de nos voisins. Personne ne doit chercher à trouver l'origine de ces pierres.
TEXT.German: Sagt unseren Leuten, dass wir die Wünsche unserer wilden Freunde respektieren werden. Es wird keine Nachforschungen geben.
TEXT.Italian: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.

TEXT.English: Many barrels of beer have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Plusieurs tonneaux de bière ont été volés dans l'entrepôt de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Aus dem Warenhaus in %s2_city wurde Bier gestohlen.
TEXT.Italian: Many barrels of beer have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Many barrels of beer have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been roobed. Cutthroats from our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of looting a cartload of beer.
TEXT.French: Des hommes sont entrés dans l'entrepôt de %s2_city par effraction. Des brigands provenant de chez nos voisins %s1_civ à %s6_city sont suspectés d'avoir pillés nos tonneaux de bières.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde aufgebrochen und ausgeraubt. Es werden Diebe von %s1_civ Nachbarn in %s6_city verdächtigt, den Überfall begangen und eine Ladung Beer geraubt zu haben.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been roobed. Cutthroats from our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of looting a cartload of beer.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been roobed. Cutthroats from our %s1_civ neighbours in %s6_city are suspected of looting a cartload of beer.

TEXT.English: Let them keep the beer, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway. This is not worth getting us into troubles with our neighbours.
TEXT.French: Laissons-les garder la bière, le niveau d'alcoolisme dans nos colonies nous cause de toute façon des soucis. Ne nous attirons pas d'ennuis avec nos voisins sur une affaire aussi bénigne.
TEXT.German: Lasst ihnen das Bier, es wurde sowieso Zeit gegen die Trunkenheit in unserer Kolonie vorzugehen und diese Geschichte ist auch keinen Streit mit unseren Nachbarn wert.
TEXT.Italian: Let them keep the beer, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway. This is not worth getting us into troubles with our neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them keep the beer, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway. This is not worth getting us into troubles with our neighbours.

TEXT.English: Our workers will revolt if they are running low on beer. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.French: Nos travailleurs se révolteront s'ils n'ont plus de bière. Arrêtons-les ! Prenons les armes !
TEXT.German: Die Arbeiter werden einen Aufstand anzetteln, wenn das Bier ausgeht. Haltet sie auf! Zu den Waffen, Männer!
TEXT.Italian: Our workers will revolt if they are running low on beer. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our workers will revolt if they are running low on beer. Stop them! Take up your arms!

TEXT.English: Only the beer was stolen? Nobody was hurt? Send them more beer as a sign of our friendship.
TEXT.French: Seule la bière a été volée ? Personne n'est blessé ? Envoyez-leur davantage de bières en signe d'amitié.
TEXT.German: Sie haben nur das Bier gestohlen? Niemand wurde verletzt? Schickt ihnen noch eine zusätzliche Ladung, um unsere Freundschaft zu untermauern.
TEXT.Italian: Only the beer was stolen? Nobody was hurt? Send them more beer as a sign of our friendship.
TEXT.Spanish: Only the beer was stolen? Nobody was hurt? Send them more beer as a sign of our friendship.

TEXT.English: Our good beer has drawn some settlers from our %s1_civ neighbours to our colonies.
TEXT.French: La qualité de notre bière a amené des colons de nos voisins s1_civ à venir visiter nos colonies.
TEXT.German: Unser gutes Bier hat einige Siedler von %s1_civ überzeugt in unsere Kolonien umzusiedeln.
TEXT.Italian: Our good beer has drawn some settlers from our %s1_civ neighbours to our colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Our good beer has drawn some settlers from our %s1_civ neighbours to our colonies.

TEXT.English: Some barrels of wine have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Plusieurs tonneaux de vin ont été volés dans l'entrepôt de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Aus dem Warenhaus in %s2_city wurde Wein gestohlen.
TEXT.Italian: Some barrels of wine have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Some barrels of wine have been stolen from the warehouse in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A warehouse in %s2_city has been robbed. Several barrels of wine are missing. Some young hotspurs of the city are suspected of being behind all this. The citizens see this affair as a funny prank.
TEXT.French: Des hommes sont entrés dans l'entrepôt de %s2_city par effraction. Plusieurs tonneaux de bières sont manquants. Des jeunes délinquants de la ville sont suspectés d'être à l'origine du délit. Les citoyens voit cette affaire comme une farce amusante.
TEXT.German: Ein Lagerhaus in %s2_city wurde aufgebrochen und einige Fässer Wein geraubt. Es werden es werden junge Männer aus der Stadt selbst verdächtigt. Die Bürger sehen darin einen lustigen Streich.
TEXT.Italian: A warehouse in %s2_city has been robbed. Several barrels of wine are missing. Some young hotspurs of the city are suspected of being behind all this. The citizens see this affair as a funny prank.
TEXT.Spanish: A warehouse in %s2_city has been robbed. Several barrels of wine are missing. Some young hotspurs of the city are suspected of being behind all this. The citizens see this affair as a funny prank.

TEXT.English: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Going hard on them would only upset the population.
TEXT.French: Et bien dans ce cas laissons les garder le vin. Personne n'a été blessée. Une punition trop stricte risque d'énerver la population.
TEXT.German: Lasst ihnen den Wein. Wegen eines Streichs einiger Jungendliche hart vorzugehen, würde nur für Unruhe sorgen.
TEXT.Italian: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Going hard on them would only upset the population.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Going hard on them would only upset the population.

TEXT.English: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas qu'une farce, c'est un vol ! Envoyez nos soldats pour arrêter ces criminels. Ils doivent être punis sévèrement !
TEXT.German: Diesen Diebstahl kann man nicht als Streich einiger Jugendlicher durchgehen lassen. Schickt Männer aus um die Diebe zu fangen, damit sie hart bestraft werden.
TEXT.Italian: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!
TEXT.Spanish: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!

TEXT.English: Social unrest in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Révolte sociale à %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Aus dem Warenhaus in %s2_city wurde Wein gestohlen.
TEXT.Italian: Social unrest in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Social unrest in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: There is social unrest in %s2_city. The poorer people have joined with drunks and troublemakers and are marching towards one of our warehouses with luxury goods. It seems as if they are about to raid it.
TEXT.French: Il y a une révolte sociale à %s2_city. Des pauvres, des alcooliques et des perturbateurs se sont regroupés et marchent en direction de l'un de nos entrepôts qui contient des denrées précieuses. Ils semblent vouloir le piller.
TEXT.German: Es herrschen soziale Unruhen in %s2_city. Die Armen haben sich mit Betrunken und Raufbolden zusammengetan und marschieren auf eines unserer Warenhäuser, dasss Luxuswaren beinhalten. Es scheint als würden sie dieses plündern wollen.
TEXT.Italian: There is social unrest in %s2_city. The poorer people have joined with drunks and troublemakers and are marching towards one of our warehouses with luxury goods. It seems as if they are about to raid it.
TEXT.Spanish: There is social unrest in %s2_city. The poorer people have joined with drunks and troublemakers and are marching towards one of our warehouses with luxury goods. It seems as if they are about to raid it.

TEXT.English: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize again.
TEXT.French: Laissez les donc dépenser leur énergie. La situation se normalisera à nouveau plus tard.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie etwas Dampf ablassen. Die Situation wird sich bald wieder beruhigen.
TEXT.Italian: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize again.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize again.

TEXT.English: We must show a hard hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and imprison all troublemakers over night.
TEXT.French: Nous devons montrer notre intransigeance ! Envoyez les troupes pour disperser la foule et emprisonner les perturbateurs dans la nuit.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen hart durchgreifen. Entsendet die lokalen Truppen um die Menge auseinanderzutreiben. Alle Unruhenstifter sollen über Nacht eingesperrt werden.
TEXT.Italian: We must show a hard hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and imprison all troublemakers over night.
TEXT.Spanish: We must show a hard hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and imprison all troublemakers over night.

TEXT.English: Conflict between cowboys and shepherds in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Contflit entre des éleveurs et des bergers à %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Streit zwischen Rinderzüchtern und Schafzüchtern in %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: Conflict between cowboys and shepherds in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Conflict between cowboys and shepherds in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A serious conflict between cowboys and shepherds has arisen in %s2_city. Each side claims that the other side has too much animals and is destroying pastures and watering places.
TEXT.French: Un conflit sérieux entre des cowboys et des bergers a éclaté à %s2_city. Les deux camps considèrent que l'autre élève trop d'animaux et leur limite leur zone de pâturage.
TEXT.German: Ein ernsthaftern Konflikt zwischen Rinderzüchtern und Schafzüchtern in %s2_city keimt auf. Jede Seite behauptet, dass die andere die Weiden überweidet und die Wasserstellen verschmutzt.
TEXT.Italian: A serious conflict between cowboys and shepherds has arisen in %s2_city. Each side claims that the other side has too much animals and is destroying pastures and watering places.
TEXT.Spanish: A serious conflict between cowboys and shepherds has arisen in %s2_city. Each side claims that the other side has too much animals and is destroying pastures and watering places.

TEXT.English: Some of the cattle shall be slaughtered instantly. There is just too much of it.
TEXT.French: Une partie des bovins doit être abattu immédiatement. Il y en a simplement trop.
TEXT.German: Ein Teil der Rinder soll geschlachtet werden. Es sind einfach zu viele.
TEXT.Italian: Some of the cattle shall be slaughtered instantly. There is just too much of it.
TEXT.Spanish: Some of the cattle shall be slaughtered instantly. There is just too much of it.

TEXT.English: Slaughter some of the sheep. They are not needed in these amounts.
TEXT.French: Abattez une partie des moutons. Nous en avons besoin.
TEXT.German: Schlachtet einige der Schafe. Sie werden nicht in dieser Zahl gebraucht.
TEXT.Italian: Slaughter some of the sheep. They are not needed in these amounts.
TEXT.Spanish: Slaughter some of the sheep. They are not needed in these amounts.

TEXT.English: We will not pick sides in this conflict. They will calm down again eventually.
TEXT.French: Nous ne prendrons pas parti dans ce conflit. Ils finiront bien par se calmer.
TEXT.German: Wir dürfen uns hier auf keine Seite stellen. Sie werden sich eh bald wieder beruhigen.
TEXT.Italian: We will not pick sides in this conflict. They will calm down again eventually.
TEXT.Spanish: We will not pick sides in this conflict. They will calm down again eventually.

TEXT.English: Many horses are bred in the region around %s2_city.
TEXT.French: De nombreux chevaux sont élevés dans la région autour de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Viele Pferde werden in der Gegend um %s2_city gezüchtet.
TEXT.Italian: Many horses are bred in the region around %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Many horses are bred in the region around %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A newly arrived immigrant has bought some land several miles away from %s2_city. He is dreaming of becoming a rancher and breeding horses. However he does not have much money left to buy the livestock needed.
TEXT.French: Un immigrant nouvellement arrivé a acheté des terres aux alentours de %s2_city. Il rêve de devenir un propriétaire de ranch et d'élever des chevaux. Cependant il ne lui reste plus beaucoup d'argent pour acheter les animaux nécessaires.
TEXT.German: Ein kürzlich eingetroffener Immigrant hat sich etwas Land einige Meilen von %s2_city entfernt gekauft. Er träumt davon ein Rancher zu werden und Pferde zu züchten. Er hat jedoch kaum noch Geld übrig um sich die Pferde zu kaufen.
TEXT.Italian: A newly arrived immigrant has bought some land several miles away from %s2_city. He is dreaming of becoming a rancher and breeding horses. However he does not have much money left to buy the livestock needed.
TEXT.Spanish: A newly arrived immigrant has bought some land several miles away from %s2_city. He is dreaming of becoming a rancher and breeding horses. However he does not have much money left to buy the livestock needed.

TEXT.English: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses to start breeding for a low price. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse of his best breed.
TEXT.French: Proposez lui un marché. Nous lui vendrons suffisamment de chevaux pour à un prix bas pour qu'il puisse commencer son affaire. En échange, il devra nous fournir régulièrement avec ses meilleurs chevaux.
TEXT.German: Bietet dem Mann einen Handel an. Wir werden ihm genug Pferde für seine Zucht zu einem sehr niedrigen Preis verkaufen. Im Gegenzug soll er uns ab und zu eines seiner besten Zuchtpferde bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses to start breeding for a low price. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse of his best breed.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses to start breeding for a low price. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse of his best breed.

TEXT.English: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.
TEXT.French: C'est dommage mais nous ne disposons pas de suffisamment de chevaux pour l'aider.
TEXT.German: Leider haben wir keine Pferde, die wir einfach abgeben könnten.
TEXT.Italian: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.
TEXT.Spanish: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.

TEXT.English: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing.
TEXT.French: La réputation de notre théâtre à %s2_city est grandissante.
TEXT.German: Der Ruf des Theaters in %s2_city wächst.
TEXT.Italian: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing.
TEXT.Spanish: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing.

TEXT.English: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing. A famous group of actors from Europe is willing to perform there. Shall we hire them?
TEXT.French: La réputation de notre théâtre à %s2_city est grandissante. Un groupe d'acteurs célèbres venu d'Europe veut s'y produire. Devons-nous les engager ?
TEXT.German: Der Ruf des Theaters in %s2_city wächst. Eine Gruppe berühmter Schauspieler aus Europa ist bereit dort aufzutreten. Sollen wir sie engagieren?
TEXT.Italian: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing. A famous group of actors from Europe is willing to perform there. Shall we hire them?
TEXT.Spanish: The reputation of the theater in %s2_city is growing. A famous group of actors from Europe is willing to perform there. Shall we hire them?

TEXT.English: Famous Actors? Of course they shall be hired. We really need more culture in our colonies.
TEXT.French: Des acteurs célèbres ? Bien sûr que nous devons les engager. Nous avons vraiment besoin de développer la culture dans nos colonies.
TEXT.German: Berühmte Schauspieler würden bei uns auftreten. Worauf wartet ihr noch? Setzt sofort den Vertrag auf.
TEXT.Italian: Famous Actors? Of course they shall be hired. We really need more culture in our colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Famous Actors? Of course they shall be hired. We really need more culture in our colonies.

TEXT.English: We have no money to spare for such things. Culture is the least of our concerns.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas d'argent pour ce genre de choses. Développer la culture n'est pas ce qui est le plus stratégique en ce moment.
TEXT.German: Wir haben kein Geld für sowetwas übrig. Kultur is unser geringstes Problem.
TEXT.Italian: We have no money to spare for such things. Culture is the least of our concerns.
TEXT.Spanish: We have no money to spare for such things. Culture is the least of our concerns.

TEXT.English: Prostitutes in the saloon of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Des prostitués dans le saloon de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Prostituierte im Saloon von %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: Prostitutes in the saloon of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Prostitutes in the saloon of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Some women have recently arrived in %s2_city and want to work as bar ladies in the saloon. Once the women of %s2_city heard about that they started rioting. They claim that those bar ladies are prostitutes and would seduce their good men. If we don't chase those bar ladies away, the women will riot.
TEXT.French: Des femmes sont récemment arrivées à %s2_city et souhaitent travailler en tant que danseuses dans le saloon. Lorsque les femmes de %s2_city ont entendu parler de cette histoire, elles ont commencé à manifester. Elles prétendent que ses danseuses sont en fait des prostitués qui veulent s'en prendre à leurs hommes. Si nous ne chassons pas les danseuses, une émeute va éclater.
TEXT.German: Eine Frauen sind in %s2_city eingetroffen und wollen im Saloon als Barfrauen arbeiten. Sobald die Frauen von %s2_city davon Wind bekommen haben, haben sie sofort einen kleinen Aufstand angezettelt. Sie behaupten dass diese Barfrauen in Wahrheit Prostituierte seien und ihre guten Männer verführen wollten. Wenn wir diese Barfrauen nicht verjagen, werden die Frauen durchdrehen.
TEXT.Italian: Some women have recently arrived in %s2_city and want to work as bar ladies in the saloon. Once the women of %s2_city heard about that they started rioting. They claim that those bar ladies are prostitutes and would seduce their good men. If we don't chase those bar ladies away, the women will riot.
TEXT.Spanish: Some women have recently arrived in %s2_city and want to work as bar ladies in the saloon. Once the women of %s2_city heard about that they started rioting. They claim that those bar ladies are prostitutes and would seduce their good men. If we don't chase those bar ladies away, the women will riot.

TEXT.English: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.
TEXT.French: Certes, mais si nous autorisons nos hommes à se relaxer, ça ne peut pas faire tant de mal et ils travailleront mieux.
TEXT.German: Ach was solls. Wenn wir den Männern etwas Entspannung gönnen, werden sie nur härter arbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.

TEXT.English: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.
TEXT.French: Des prostitués dans nos villes ? Chassez cette perversion immédiatement !
TEXT.German: Prostituierte in unserer Stadt ? Jagdt diese dreckigen Weibsbilder sofort weg.
TEXT.Italian: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.
TEXT.Spanish: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.

TEXT.English: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Un animal sauvage dangereux effraie les citoyens de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Wildes Tier verängstigt Bevölkerung von %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city. They ask for our help.
TEXT.French: Une animal sauvage dangereux effraie les citoyens de %s2_city. Ils demandent de l'aide.
TEXT.German: Ein wildes Tier verängstigt die Bevölkerung von %s2_city. Sie bitten um unsere Hilfe.
TEXT.Italian: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city. They ask for our help.
TEXT.Spanish: A dangerous wild animal is scaring the citizens of %s2_city. They ask for our help.

TEXT.English: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.
TEXT.French: Donnez leur les armes stockés dans la ville. Ils doivent former une milice et se protéger par eux-mêmes.
TEXT.German: Gebt ihnen einige der gelagterten Waffen. Sie sollen eine Miliz aufstellen und sich selbst beschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.
TEXT.Spanish: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.

TEXT.English: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.
TEXT.French: Nous allons engager des chasseurs pour qu'ils s'occupent de cet animal sauvage.
TEXT.German: Wir werden Jäger anheuern, die dieses Tier zur Strecke bringen werden.
TEXT.Italian: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.
TEXT.Spanish: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.

TEXT.English: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est qu'un animal. Il n'y a pas besoin de larmoyer comme un enfant.
TEXT.German: Es handelt sich doch nur um ein Tier. Sie sollen endlich aufhören wie kleine Kinder zu weinen.
TEXT.Italian: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.
TEXT.Spanish: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.

TEXT.English: Smugglers caught in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Des contrebandiers ont été attrapés à %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Schmuggler in %s2_city gefasst.
TEXT.Italian: Smugglers caught in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Smugglers caught in %s2_city.

TEXT.English: The officials in %s2_city have caught some smugglers. They were buying salt and other goods from private traders in the city and selling it without paying customs at high profits in Europe.
TEXT.French: Des officiers de %s2_city ont attrapés des contrebandiers. Ils étaient en train d'acheter du sel et d'autres biens lorsqu'un négociant privé de la ville leur a vendu sans payer les droits de douane pour l'Europe.
TEXT.German: Die Offiziellen in %s2_city haben einige Schmuggler geschnappt. Diese haben Salz und andere Güter von privaten Händlern gekauft und dieses dann am Zoll vorbei in Europa zu hohen Profiten verkauft.
TEXT.Italian: The officials in %s2_city have caught some smugglers. They were buying salt and other goods from private traders in the city and selling it without paying customs at high profits in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: The officials in %s2_city have caught some smugglers. They were buying salt and other goods from private traders in the city and selling it without paying customs at high profits in Europe.

TEXT.English: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.
TEXT.French: Confisquez le navire et renvoyez les criminels pour qu'ils soient jugés en Europe.
TEXT.German: Konfisziert das Schiff und übergebt diese Gauner den Behörden in Europa.
TEXT.Italian: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.

TEXT.English: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered anymore.
TEXT.French: Proposez leur un marché. Tant qu'ils nous offrent une partie du sel qu'ils achètent, ils n'auront pas d'ennuis.
TEXT.German: Bietet ihnen einen Handel an. Solange sie uns regelmässig einen kleinen Teil des Salzes geben, welches sie erwerben, sollen sie von uns unbehelligt bleiben.
TEXT.Italian: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered anymore.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered anymore.

TEXT.English: A chief's daughter fell in love with a white scout.
TEXT.French: La fille d'un chef amérindien est tombée amoureuse d'un de nos éclaireurs.
TEXT.German: Die Tochter eines Häuptlings hat sich in einen weissen Scout verliebt.
TEXT.Italian: A chief's daughter fell in love with a white scout.
TEXT.Spanish: A chief's daughter fell in love with a white scout.

TEXT.English: The chief's daughter and our scout fell in love. The chief himself is not very happy but loves his daughter and thus will allow the marriage if we agree as well. If they marry, the scout will stay in the village and not work for us any longer.
TEXT.French: La fille d'un chef amérindien et l'un de nos éclaireurs sont tombés amoureux. Le chef n'est pas très heureux mais adorent sa fille, il acceptera donc le mariage si nous donnons également notre accord. S'ils se marrient, l'éclaireur restera dans le village et abandonnera sa mission.
TEXT.German: Die Tochter des Häuptlings und unser Scout haben sich verliebt. Der Häuptling ist darüber nicht besonders erfreut, liebt jedoch seine Tochter und wird der Hochzeit zustimmen, wenn auch wir unsere Zustimmung geben. Falls die beiden heiraten, wird der Scout im Dorf bleiben und nicht mehr für uns arbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: The chief's daughter and our scout fell in love. The chief himself is not very happy but loves his daughter and thus will allow the marriage if we agree as well. If they marry, the scout will stay in the village and not work for us any longer.
TEXT.Spanish: The chief's daughter and our scout fell in love. The chief himself is not very happy but loves his daughter and thus will allow the marriage if we agree as well. If they marry, the scout will stay in the village and not work for us any longer.

TEXT.English: We will allow the marriage if the chief sends us some of his warriors and some gold as dowry.
TEXT.French: Nous accepterons le mariage si le Chef nous envoie quelques-uns de ses guerriers en guise de dot.
TEXT.German: Wir werden der Hochzeit zustimmen, wenn der Häuptling uns einige seiner Krieger und etwas Gold als Mitgift schickt.
TEXT.Italian: We will allow the marriage if the chief sends us some of his warriors and some gold as dowry.
TEXT.Spanish: We will allow the marriage if the chief sends us some of his warriors and some gold as dowry.

TEXT.English: That is not possible. The scout has a duty to fulfill.
TEXT.French: C'est malheureusement impossible, l'éclaireur doit poursuivre sa mission.
TEXT.German: Das ist leider nicht möglich. Der Scout hat einen Auftrag zu erledigen.
TEXT.Italian: That is not possible. The scout has a duty to fulfill.
TEXT.Spanish: That is not possible. The scout has a duty to fulfill.

TEXT.English: While passing a Native village, one of our Native Mercenaries has been invited to stay for a while to exchange stories and knowledge.
TEXT.French: En passant dans un village amérindien, l'un de nos mercenaires indigènes a été invité à rester un temps pour un échange d'histoire et de savoir.
TEXT.German: Während einer unserer Indianischen Söldner ein anderes Ureinwohnerdorf durchwanderte, wurde er eingeladen eine Weile zu bleiben um Geschichten auszutauschen und neues Wissen zu erlangen.
TEXT.Italian: While passing a Native village, one of our Native Mercenaries has been invited to stay for a while to exchange stories and knowledge.
TEXT.Spanish: While passing a Native village, one of our Native Mercenaries has been invited to stay for a while to exchange stories and knowledge.

TEXT.English: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.
TEXT.French: Notre mercenaire peut rester quelques temps. Gagner davantage de connaissances est toujours une bonne chose.
TEXT.German: Der Indianischen Söldner kann ruhig eine Weile in dem Dorf bleiben. Der Austausch von Wissen ist immer sinnvoll.
TEXT.Italian: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.

TEXT.English: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas possible. On a besoin immédiatement de notre unité de mercenaire.
TEXT.German: Das ist leider nicht möglich. Der Indianischen Söldner wird dringend an anderer Stelle gebraucht.
TEXT.Italian: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.

TEXT.English: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.French: Un médecin venu d'Europe souhaite combattre la maladie de l'Homme Blanc qui se propage dans les villages indigènes.
TEXT.German: Ein Arzt aus Europa will die Krankheiten des Weissen Mannes bekämpfen, die sich in den Dörfern der Ureinwohner verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.Spanish: Medical Doctor from Europe wants to fight diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.

TEXT.English: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.French: Un médecin venu d'Europe est arrivé dans l'une de nos ville. Il sait que les indigènes souffrent actuellement d'une épidémie venue d'Europe et souhaite la combattre.
TEXT.German: Ein Arzt aus Europa ist in einer unserer Städte eingetroffen und will die Krankheiten des Weissen Mannes bekämpfen, die sich in den Dörfern der Ureinwohner verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.
TEXT.Spanish: A medical doctor from Europe has arrived in on of our cities. He heard about the situation of the Natives and now wants to fight the diseases of the White Man that are spreading in Native Villages.

TEXT.English: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.
TEXT.French: La mission est noble. Il a tout notre soutien.
TEXT.German: Dieses noble Anliegen hat unsere volle Unterstützung.
TEXT.Italian: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a noble mission. He has got our full support.

TEXT.English: A man with such valuable knowledge cannot be left wandering in the wilderness. He must stay in our city and cure the sick there.
